alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 10:39AM MST until December 23 at 3:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
